item.title: 【Why It’s Time to Reevaluate Quality Control Methods in Data Labeling】为什么是时候重新评估数据标签中的质量控制方法了
item.description:
【

What if the foundation of your AI models is built on flawed data without you knowing?

The era of AI data labeling has undergone a dramatic transformation. What once involved straightforward tasks, such as answering “Is there a cat in this image?” or drawing bounding boxes around clearly defined objects, now demands sophisticated data preparation. Modern data labeling is far more complex: multi-modal datasets require deep semantic understanding, subjective judgments vary across cultures, and edge cases necessitate contextual understanding. Traditional quality control frameworks, designed for simpler, more objective labeling tasks, are no longer adequate to meet these challenges.

】

如果您不知道的AI模型的基础是在有缺陷的数据上构建的？

AI数据标记的时代经历了巨大的转换。曾经涉及到直接任务的涉及到的什么，例如回答“此图像中有猫？”或围绕明确定义的对象绘制边界框，现在需要复杂的数据准备。现代数据标记要复杂得多：多模式数据集需要深入的语义理解，主观判断在各种文化之间各不相同，而边缘案例需要上下文理解。传统的质量控制框架（用于简单，更客观的标签任务）不再足以应对这些挑战。

item.title: 【Implementing Write-Through Cache for Real-Time Data Processing: A Scalable Approach】实现实时数据处理的写入缓存：可扩展的方法
item.description:
【

Real-time data processing systems often struggle with balancing performance and data consistency when handling high volumes of transactions. This article explores how a write-through local cache can optimize performance.

Introduction to Write-Through Caches

A write-through cache is a caching strategy where data is written to both the cache and the backing store simultaneously. This approach ensures that the cache always contains the most recent data while maintaining consistency with the underlying data store.

】

实时数据处理系统在处理大量交易时通常会在平衡性能和数据一致性方面挣扎。本文探讨了本地缓存如何优化性能。

写入caches

简介

写入缓存是一种缓存策略，其中数据同时将数据写入缓存和背景存储店。这种方法可确保缓存始终包含最新数据，同时保持与基础数据存储的一致性。

item.title: 【The Death of Static Rules: Making Microservices Smart, Flexible and Easy to Change】静态规则的死亡：使微服务智能，灵活且易于更改
item.description:
【

Hey, team!  Lately I have hit a wall, my microservices are so dominated with hardcoded rules that adjusting even the smallest nuance in policy was like disarming a bomb. I'm going to take you on my journey from messy if/else trees to clean, policy-driven microservices that update themselves (no redeploys). This will include every step from zero (no experience required) to hero, as well as some real-world examples, some questions for you to ponder and ideas you can use today. Let's go!

What’s Wrong With Hardcoded Rules?

A Simple Example—and Why It Sucks

Let's say you are building an e-commerce checkout service. The service needs to charge a small surcharge when customers are located in certain countries. So, you write:

】

嘿，团队！  最近，我撞到了墙，我的微服务如此主导了硬编码规则，以至于调整了政策中最小的细微差别，就像解除了炸弹的武装一样。我将带您从Mysy if/else trees 清洁自我更新自我（无红eploys）。这将包括从零（无需经验）到英雄的每个步骤，以及一些现实世界中的例子，一些问题供您思考，以及您今天可以使用的想法。让我们走！

硬编码规则有什么问题？

一个简单的例子 - 为什么它很烂

假设您正在建立电子商务结帐服务。当客户位于某些国家 /地区时，该服务需要收取少量附加费。因此，您写信：

item.title: 【Keep Your Search Cluster Fit: Essential Health Checks to Keep Elasticsearch Healthy】保持搜索群体拟合：基本的健康检查以保持Elasticsearch健康
item.description:
【

Elasticsearch (ES) is a powerful and distributed search and analytics engine, widely adopted for full-text search, logging, metrics, and real-time analytics. As the cornerstone of many data-driven systems, maintaining Elasticsearch’s health is crucial to ensure continuous availability, performance, and data integrity. A degraded or failing ES cluster can disrupt mission-critical applications, increase latency, or even cause data loss.

To keep your Elasticsearch environment running smoothly, regular health checks must be conducted. These checks help detect early warning signs—such as disk saturation, unbalanced shards, or failed nodes before they escalate into critical failures. However, performing these tasks manually can be time-consuming and error-prone, especially in production environments with many nodes and indices.

】

alasticsearch （es）是一种强大而有力的搜索和分析引擎，广泛用于全范围搜索，cext搜索，colegging，lemgging，legging，celece andime core neque time core neque andime core neque time neque time core neque timess extime siless及时分析。作为许多数据驱动系统的基石，维持Elasticsearch的健康对于确保持续可用性，性能和数据完整性至关重要。退化或失败的ES群集会破坏关键任务应用程序，增加延迟甚至导致数据丢失。

以保持您的elasticsearch环境顺利运行，必须进行常规的健康检查。这些检查有助于检测预警信号，例如磁盘饱和，不平衡的碎片或失败的节点，然后才能升级为重大故障。但是，手动执行这些任务可能耗时且容易出错，尤其是在具有许多节点和索引的生产环境中。

item.title: 【Integration Testing AI Prompts With Ollama and Spring TestContainers】集成测试AI提示与Ollama和Spring TestContainers
item.description:
【

AI features are becoming common in modern applications. If your Spring Boot app uses large language models (LLMs), it’s important to test how those models respond to real prompts. This helps you catch issues early and keeps your app reliable.

In this article, you’ll learn how to write integration tests for AI prompts using Spring TestContainers and Ollama. You’ll see how to set up your environment, write prompt tests, and apply good testing practices - all using standard JUnit and Spring Boot.

】

AI特征在现代应用中变得很普遍。如果您的Spring Boot应用程序使用大型语言模型（LLMS），那么测试这些模型如何响应真实提示很重要。这可以帮助您尽早发现问题并保持应用程序可靠。

在本文中，您将学习如何使用Spring TestContainers和Ollama编写AI提示的集成测试。您将看到如何设置环境，编写及时测试并应用良好的测试实践 - 所有这些都使用标准Junit和Spring Boot。

item.title: 【Implementing Budget Policies and Budget Limits on Databricks】在数据映中实施预算政策和预算限制
item.description:
【

This guide walks us through the steps to implement Budget Policies and Budget Policy limits on Serverless Compute in Databricks to effectively and accurately compute the costs incurred for compute usage. This guide covers step by step process of the implementation on the data platform to monitor and account for the cost incurred effectively.

Pre-Requisites

  • Databricks Admin access to set policies, view usage, manage tokens
  • Cluster Policy enabled to restrict compute types, enforce limits
  • Tags in place for team/project-level cost tracking
  • REST API/token access  for automation and enforcement
  • Reporting tools to visualize and alert on usage
  • Communication plan to ensure user awareness and adoption

Introduction

Databricks becomes central to analytics and AI pipelines, it's crucial to balance performance with cost control. Serverless compute simplifies scalability, but without budget policies and usage limits, costs can spiral.

】

本指南介绍了在数据映中实施无服务器计算的预算政策和预算政策限制的步骤，以有效并准确计算计算使用费用的成本。本指南涵盖了在数据平台上实施的逐步过程，以监视和说明有效产生的成本。

先决条件

  • Databricks管理员访问设置策略，查看用法，管理令牌
  • 集群策略启用了限制计算类型，执行限制
  • 为团队/项目级成本跟踪的标签
  • REST API/令牌访问自动化和执行
  • 报告可视化和警报使用的工具
  • 沟通计划以确保用户意识和采用

简介

databricks 是分析和AI管道的核心，它是与成本控制的重要性。 neverless Compute 简化可扩展性，但没有预算策略和用法限制，成本可以螺旋式螺旋螺旋。

item.title: 【Tuples and Records (Part 1): What They Mean for JavaScript Performance and Predictability】元组和记录（第1部分）：它们对JavaScript性能和可预测性意味着什么
item.description:
【

JavaScript continually evolves to address modern development needs. Its latest updates often reflect trends in functional programming and immutable data handling. Two upcoming additions to the language, Tuples and Records, aim to simplify immutability while enhancing efficiency and developer experience.

This article delves into these new features, discussing their purpose, syntax, benefits, and use cases.

】 JavaScript不断发展以满足现代发展需求。它的最新更新通常反映出功能编程和不变数据处理的趋势。该语言即将到来的两个添加，元组和记录，旨在简化不变性的同时提高效率和开发人员的经验。

本文深入研究这些新功能，讨论其目的，语法，好处和用例。

item.title: 【Development of System Configuration Management: Handling Exclusive Configurations and Associated Templates】系统配置管理的开发：处理独家配置和相关模板

The complete series:

】

系列概述

本文是多部分系列的第2.3部分：“系统配置管理的开发。”

item.title: 【MCP for Agentic Systems: The Missing Protocol for Autonomous AI】代理系统的MCP：自主AI的缺失协议
item.description:
【

Introduction: Why Agentic Systems Need MCP

Model Context Protocol (MCP) is a standardized communication framework specifically designed to manage complex, stateful interactions between AI agents and backend infrastructure. If you've moved beyond simple LLM completions and are building agentic applications, you've likely experienced the complexity. An agent, unlike a basic chatbot, perceives, reasons, plans, and acts dynamically. Managing its evolving state — plans, internal reasoning, tool usage history, and environmental understanding — rapidly becomes complex, brittle, and difficult to scale using traditional REST APIs.

MCP provides a structured solution, centralizing state management and enabling clean, maintainable agent implementations.

】

简介：为什么代理系统需要MCP

模型上下文上下文协议（MCP）是一个标准化的通信框架，专门旨在管理AI Agents Adents and Agents and Backend and Backend and Backend Infrastruce之间的复杂，状态相互作用。如果您已经超越了简单的LLM完成并正在构建代理应用程序，那么您可能会经历复杂性。与基本聊天机器人不同的代理商会感知，理由，计划和动态行动。管理其不断发展的状态 - 计划，内部推理，工具使用历史记录和环境理解 - 迅速变得复杂，脆弱且难以扩展使用传统的REST API。

MCP提供了一个结构化的解决方案，集中了状态管理并实现了清洁，可维护的代理实现。

item.title: 【Toward Explainable AI (Part 4): Bridging Theory and Practice—Beyond Explainability, What Else Is Needed】迈向可解释的AI（第4部分）：桥接理论和实践 - 贝多德解释性，还需要什么
item.description:
【

Series reminder: This series explores how explainability in AI helps build trust, ensure accountability, and align with real-world needs, from foundational principles to practical use cases.

Previously, in Part III: The Two Major Categories of Explainable AI Techniques.  How XAI methods help open the black box.

】

系列提醒：本系列探讨了AI中的解释性如何帮助建立信任，确保问责制并与现实世界需求保持一致，从基本原理到实际用例。

以前，第三部分： 可解释的AI技术的两个主要类别。
